Description.Content: Provides support for building animations that perform transitions on view elements. For instance, rotating, fading, moving, and stretching on a graphic.
A container that holds other animation elements ('alpha', 'scale', 'translate', 'rotate'or other 'set' elements). Represents an AnimatorSet.
Defines the XML namespace, which must be 'http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android'.

An Interpolator to apply on the animation. The value must be a reference to a resource that specifies an interpolator (not an interpolator class name). There are default interpolator resources available from the platform or you can create your own interpolator resource.
Specifies the play ordering of animations in this set.
A fade-in or fade-out animation. Represents an AlphaAnimation.
Defines the XML namespace, which must be 'http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android'.
Special option for window animations: if this window is on top of a wallpaper, don't animate the wallpaper with it.
Amount of time (in milliseconds) for the animation to run.

When set to true, the animation transformation is applied after the animation is over. The default value is false. If fillEnabled is not set to true and the animation is not set on a View, fillAfter is assumed to be true.
When set to true or when fillEnabled is not set to true, the animation transformation is applied before the animation has started. The default value is true.
When set to true, the value of fillBefore is taken into account.
Defines the interpolator used to smooth the animation movement in time.
Defines how many times the animation should repeat. The default value is 0
Infinitely repeats the animation.
Defines the animation behavior when it reaches the end and the repeat count is greater than 0 or infinite. The default value is restart.
The animation starts again from the beginning.
The animation plays backward.
Delay in milliseconds before the animation runs, once start time is reached.
Allows for an adjustment of the Z ordering of the content being animated for the duration of the animation. The default value is normal.
The content being animated be kept in its current Z order.
The content being animated is forced on top of all other content for the duration of the animation.
The content being animated is forced under all other content for the duration of the animation.
Starting opacity offset, where 0.0 is transparent and 1.0 is opaque.
Ending opacity offset, where 0.0 is transparent and 1.0 is opaque.

A resizing animation. You can specify the center point of the image from which it grows outward (or inward) by specifying pivotX and pivotY. For example, if these values are 0, 0 (top-left corner), all growth will be down and to the right. Represents a ScaleAnimation.
Defines the XML namespace, which must be 'http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android'.
Special option for window animations: if this window is on top of a wallpaper, don't animate the wallpaper with it.
Amount of time (in milliseconds) for the animation to run.

When set to true, the animation transformation is applied after the animation is over. The default value is false. If fillEnabled is not set to true and the animation is not set on a View, fillAfter is assumed to be true.
When set to true or when fillEnabled is not set to true, the animation transformation is applied before the animation has started. The default value is true.
When set to true, the value of fillBefore is taken into account.
Defines the interpolator used to smooth the animation movement in time.
Defines how many times the animation should repeat. The default value is 0
Infinitely repeats the animation.
Defines the animation behavior when it reaches the end and the repeat count is greater than 0 or infinite. The default value is restart.
The animation starts again from the beginning.
The animation plays backward.
Delay in milliseconds before the animation runs, once start time is reached.
Allows for an adjustment of the Z ordering of the content being animated for the duration of the animation. The default value is normal.
The content being animated be kept in its current Z order.
The content being animated is forced on top of all other content for the duration of the animation.
The content being animated is forced under all other content for the duration of the animation.
Starting X size offset, where 1.0 is no change.
Ending X size offset, where 1.0 is no change.
Starting Y size offset, where 1.0 is no change.
End Y size offset, where 1.0 is no change.
The X coordinate to remain fixed when the object is scaled.
The Y coordinate to remain fixed when the object is scaled.

A vertical and/or horizontal motion. Supports the following attributes in any of the following three formats: values from -100 to 100 ending with '#37;', indicating a percentage relative to itself; values from -100 to 100 ending in '#37;', indicating a percentage relative to its parent; a float value with no suffix, indicating an absolute value. Represents a TranslateAnimation.
Defines the XML namespace, which must be 'http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android'.
Special option for window animations: if this window is on top of a wallpaper, don't animate the wallpaper with it.
Amount of time (in milliseconds) for the animation to run.

When set to true, the animation transformation is applied after the animation is over. The default value is false. If fillEnabled is not set to true and the animation is not set on a View, fillAfter is assumed to be true.
When set to true or when fillEnabled is not set to true, the animation transformation is applied before the animation has started. The default value is true.
When set to true, the value of fillBefore is taken into account.
Defines the interpolator used to smooth the animation movement in time.
Defines how many times the animation should repeat. The default value is 0
Infinitely repeats the animation.
Defines the animation behavior when it reaches the end and the repeat count is greater than 0 or infinite. The default value is restart.
The animation starts again from the beginning.
The animation plays backward.
Delay in milliseconds before the animation runs, once start time is reached.
Allows for an adjustment of the Z ordering of the content being animated for the duration of the animation. The default value is normal.
The content being animated be kept in its current Z order.
The content being animated is forced on top of all other content for the duration of the animation.
The content being animated is forced under all other content for the duration of the animation.

Starting X offset. Expressed either: in pixels relative to the normal position (such as '5'), in percentage relative to the element width (such as '5%'), or in percentage relative to the parent width (such as '5%p').

Ending X offset. Expressed either: in pixels relative to the normal position (such as '5'), in percentage relative to the element width (such as '5%'), or in percentage relative to the parent width (such as '5%p').

Starting Y offset. Expressed either: in pixels relative to the normal position (such as '5'), in percentage relative to the element width (such as '5%'), or in percentage relative to the parent width (such as '5%p').

Ending Y offset. Expressed either: in pixels relative to the normal position (such as '5'), in percentage relative to the element width (such as '5%'), or in percentage relative to the parent width (such as '5%p').
A rotation animation. Represents a RotateAnimation.
Defines the XML namespace, which must be 'http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android'.
Special option for window animations: if this window is on top of a wallpaper, don't animate the wallpaper with it.
Amount of time (in milliseconds) for the animation to run.

When set to true, the animation transformation is applied after the animation is over. The default value is false. If fillEnabled is not set to true and the animation is not set on a View, fillAfter is assumed to be true.
When set to true or when fillEnabled is not set to true, the animation transformation is applied before the animation has started. The default value is true.
When set to true, the value of fillBefore is taken into account.
Defines the interpolator used to smooth the animation movement in time.
Defines how many times the animation should repeat. The default value is 0
Infinitely repeats the animation.
Defines the animation behavior when it reaches the end and the repeat count is greater than 0 or infinite. The default value is restart.
The animation starts again from the beginning.
The animation plays backward.
Delay in milliseconds before the animation runs, once start time is reached.
Allows for an adjustment of the Z ordering of the content being animated for the duration of the animation. The default value is normal.
The content being animated be kept in its current Z order.
The content being animated is forced on top of all other content for the duration of the animation.
The content being animated is forced under all other content for the duration of the animation.
Starting angular position, in degrees.
Ending angular position, in degrees.

The X coordinate of the center of rotation. Expressed either: in pixels relative to the object's left edge (such as '5'), in percentage relative to the object's left edge (such as '5%'), or in percentage relative to the parent container's left edge (such as '5%p').

The Y coordinate of the center of rotation. Expressed either: in pixels relative to the object's left edge (such as '5'), in percentage relative to the object's left edge (such as '5%'), or in percentage relative to the parent container's left edge (such as '5%p').
